text: hi everyone baby spinach salad here the

time for a ra view of this new blade
album spider yes this is a new album
from Swedish rapper singer songwriter
Flagship artist of the drain gang
Collective blade fresh off of his recent
and very high quality collaboration with
Echo 2K Crest which was handily my
favorite blade related project yet but
when it comes to his solo work blade has
also slowly but surely been making
strides I know there are many fans out
there that enjoy earlier releases such
as red light for example but personally
I find a lot of what he's doing more
recently to be a lot more interesting
than the super glossy trap instrumentals
and deadpan rap singing on that project
and that's kind of interesting because
while blade has evolved quite a bit
since that record and others in his back
catalog he is simultaneously maintained
a lot of the odd somewhat awkward and
very idiosyncratic qualities about his
performance style even as he and
producer white armor flirt with the
sounds of drill with the skittering
hi-hats and bass on the intro track
understatement or the sudden pop punk
shift on I am slowly but surely losing
hope I suppose in a way the gender-bent
futurism that has always been there in
Blade's work in some capacity is really
boiling over on this record in the best
way and now it's happening with more
accessible tunes and fleshed Out song
structures the maturation of Blade
songwriting was really showing on the
last LP that he dropped the fool and
it's most definitely been continuing
onto spider now granted there are some
moments on this LP that I think run a
little um one-dimensional or brief
whether it's the very assuring it's okay
to not be okay which is a sweet little
Motif laced with these icy guitars and
keys just blissfully blipping for a

sentiment of the track really just kind
of comes down to the message of the

3 style which provides a few minutes of
lyrical Food For Thought from blade
sitting on top of this very overloaded
beat with a lot of dense shots of bass
on this track lyrically he makes
reference to his free-flowing creative
process caring more about the little
things in life and not being idolized as
a person just wanting to be regular and
normal and go on the bus and hit up the
grocery store disaster Prelude with
echo2k I suppose is an all right
centerpiece for the record blade and
echo's respective performances aren't
nearly as animated as I hoped they would
be especially given some of the
highlights off Crest plus I think the
particularly Lo-Fi production on this
track kind of dulls the color and size
of the whole thing it comes off just a
bit too muted and as long as I'm talking
about wanting more there's also the
ambient pop of Blue Crush Angel the
hushed and auto-tune vocal leads on this
track feel like a a very quiet and
Serene internal monologue but I still
wish the track had a stronger climax
things do build up a bit past the intro
for sure but the track ultimately ends
up finishing on a stagnation point but
beyond these tracks though this album
does have more highlights on it than I
found on most Blade records there is
understatement that I mentioned earlier
there's something so hype and yet
hypnotic about how this futuristic drill
inspired be syncs up with blades
slightly monotone mellow wraps the pop
punk losing hope that I talked about
earlier also has more punch and more

it's not the only track that goes in a
guitar driven Direction too because
there is Velociraptor with its buzzing
synthesizers and very aggressive perks
seasoned with these crunched up guitar
fragments it is easily one of the
biggest bangers here not to mention
blade brings an especially animated
vocal performance throwing out all this
surreal poetry featuring evocative bits
of imagery regarding perseverance and
emotional waves and the aggression on
this track contrasts really nicely with
the sparkling Sith pop on the very
enchanting Dresden ER I should also
mention haha which is easily Blade's
most unhinged track ever we have a
jittery beat on this track a rush of
electrifying synths and all these
cracked shouts of I'm crazy I'm crazy
okay
there's almost an emo Vibe coming off of

Mantra of I'm doing great which I
suppose is supposed to contrast from the
